title: My Techno song
content:
I'm creating a techno song which you can already listen: (remember, its not finished)
[url=http://files.filefront.com//;7434012;;/]files.filefront.com//;7434012;;/[/url]
please say what is good, and what is not so good.
also please give me tips so i can do anything about it.

thank you[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

ps: sorry if my english is'nt that good

title: Re: My Techno song
content:
I would heavily recommend you
a) convert to MP3 - the 15 meg download for a 1:30 track is *not* cool.
b) get some decent hosting; Opera chokes on filefront and the download speeds are atrocious.

The song itself - the idea is good. The last ~10 seconds is *excellent*; however, before that, there are points where you need to work on your transitions. Some of the samples you're using, also, sound a bit outdated - however it has *a lot* of potential - nuture it, and it will be fantastic.------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: My Techno song
content:
I would agree about converting it to MP3 etc., but I quite like it so far. Interesting melodies, some of them kind of remind me of some sort of Zelda dungeon music or something...------------------

title: Re: My Techno song
content:
I dig it. Things I noticed:

1. The volume swell when the bass comes in sounds funny.

2. Not much bass in the track. Aside from the kick, maybe some lows when the organ comes in at the end would be nice. Not that I'm a techno Xpert.

Other than that, I like the video-gamey sound.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

3)If you have a dial-up connection, its going to be slow. MP3, or not.__________________________________________

[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k296/Medevila/bphn.gif[/img]

title: Re: My Techno song
content:
According to stuff I looked up on Google/Wikipedia, the average cost of a 200kbps DSL line in Chile is about $37. That's pretty expensive, even by US standards - and when you consider that the average household income in Chile is about one seventh of that of a typical household in the USA ($4900 compared to the USA's $37500), it suddenly seems astronomical. Those "experts" going on about how "dial-up is irrelevant" aren't trying to sell stuff to anyone who doesn't live in one of the wealthiest nations.

(Before we go back on topic - it's interesting how people from the US never actually say they're from the USA and only give a state. Must have something to do with the reason they call the major league baseball championship the World Series, even though only US teams compete [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] )[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]
